problem: A scuba diver and her gear displace a volume of 69.6 L and have a total mass of 72.8 kg. (a) What is the buoyant force on the diver in seawater? (b) Will the diver sink or float?

steps.explanation: We will use Archimedes' principle to find the buoyant force and the weight formula to compare with the diver's weight.
steps.notations: B = ρ g V and W = m g

steps.explanation: Define the given values from the problem.
Substitute the numerical values into the buoyant force formula.
Substitute the numerical values into the weight formula.
Calculate the weight of the diver and gear.
Compare the buoyant force and weight to determine if the diver will sink or float.
steps.notations: Since W > B (713.4 N > 698.9 N), the diver will sink.

solution:
Part (a): Finding the buoyant force
B = ρ g V
V = 69.6 L = 6.96 × 10⁻² m³
ρ₍sea₎ = 1.025 × 10³ kg/m³
g = 9.80 m/s²
B = (1.025 × 10³ kg/m³)(9.80 m/s²)(6.96 × 10⁻² m³)
B = 698.9 N ≈ 7.0 × 10² N

Part (b): Determining if the diver will sink or float
W = m g
m = 72.8 kg
W = (72.8 kg)(9.80 m/s²)
W = 713.4 N ≈ 7.13 × 10² N
Since W > B (713.4 N > 698.9 N), the diver will sink
